com.trg.dao.search
Class Search

java.lang.Object
  com.trg.dao.search.Search
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlexSearch
public class Search
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The base search DTO (data transfer object). A Search object is passed into a DAO to define the parameters for a search. There are five types of parameters that can be set.

  • Class - The Class of the object(s) to search for. This is required. It can be specified in the constructor or using setSearchClass().
  • Filters - Any number of filters may be specified for the search. Filters specify a property and a condition that it must match for the object to be included in the result. Filters are "ANDed" together by default, but disjunction (OR) can be used instead by setting setDisjunction(true). Filters are set using addFilter() . See also the Filter class.
  • Sorts - Any number of sorts may be specified. Each sort consists of a property and a flag for ascending or descending. The first sort added is the primary sort, the second, secondary and so on. Sorts are set using addSort(). See also the Sort class.
  • Paging - The maximum number of results may be specified with setMaxResults(). (This can also be thought of as results per page.) The first result can be specified using either setFirstResult() or setPage().
  • Fetch -
    • When fetchMode == FETCH_ENTITY, this determines which attached objects to pull along with the base search object. With hibernate this eagerly loads the specified properties. Otherwise they might be loaded lazily. This is useful for performance and results that will be disconnected from hibernate and copied to a remote client. Fetches are set using addFetch().
    • For other values of fetchMode, instead of returning the actual objects, a collection of specified properties can be returned for each row in the result set. These properties can be returned in maps, lists or arrays. Fetches are specified using addFetch(). The fetch mode must also be set using setFetchMode().

      Additionally, fetches can be specified using column operators: COUNT, COUNT DISTINCT, SUM, AVG, MAX, MIN. Note that fetches with column operators can not be mixed with fetches that do not use column operators and can also not be used with fetchMode == FETCH_ENTITY.

Author:
dwolverton
See Also:
Filter, Fetch, Serialized Form

Field Detail

FETCH_ENTITY

public static final int FETCH_ENTITY
Value for fetch mode. This is the default value. FETCH_ENTITY returns the actual objects of the specified searchClass

See Also:
setFetchMode(int), Constant Field Values

FETCH_ARRAY

public static final int FETCH_ARRAY
Value for fetch mode. This is the default value. FETCH_ARRAY returns each object as an Object array (Object[]) with the entries corresponding to the fetches added to the search. Here's an example: 
 Search s = new Search(Person.class);
 s.setFetchMode(Search.FETCH_ARRAY);
 s.addFetch("firstName");
 s.addFetch("lastName");
 for (Object[] array : dao.search(s)) {
        System.out.println(array[0] + " " + array[1]);
 }

See Also:
setFetchMode(int), Constant Field Values

FETCH_LIST

public static final int FETCH_LIST
Value for fetch mode. This is the default value. FETCH_LIST returns each object as a list of Objects (List<Object> ). Here's an example: 
 Search s = new Search(Person.class);
 s.setFetchMode(Search.FETCH_LIST);
 s.addFetch("firstName");
 s.addFetch("lastName");
 for (List<Object> list : dao.search(s)) {
        System.out.println(list.get(0) + " " + list.get(1));
 }

See Also:
setFetchMode(int), Constant Field Values

FETCH_MAP

public static final int FETCH_MAP
Value for fetch mode. This is the default value. FETCH_MAP returns each object as a map with properties' names or aliases for keys to the corresponding values. Here's an example: 
 Search s = new Search(Person.class);
 s.setFetchMode(Search.FETCH_MAP;
 s.addFetch("firstName");
 s.addFetch("lastName", "ln");
 for (Map<String, Object> map : dao.search(s)) {
        System.out.println(map.get("firstName") + " " + map.get("ln"));
 }

See Also:
setFetchMode(int), Constant Field Values

FETCH_SINGLE

public static final int FETCH_SINGLE
Value for fetch mode. This is the default value. FETCH_SINGLE - Exactly one fetch property must be specified to use this fetch mode. The result list contains just the value of that property for each element. Here's an example: 
 Search s = new Search(Person.class);
 s.setFetchMode(Search.FETCH_SINGLE);
 s.addFetch("firstName");
 for (String name : dao.search(s)) {
        System.out.println(name);
 }

See Also:
setFetchMode(int), Constant Field Values

getFetchMode

setFetchMode

public Search setFetchMode(int fetchMode)
Select modes tell the search what form to use for the results. Options include FETCH_ENTITY, FETCH_ARRAY, FETCH_LIST, FETCH_MAP and FETCH_SINGLE.

See Also:
FETCH_ENTITY, FETCH_ARRAY, FETCH_LIST, FETCH_MAP, FETCH_SINGLE

clear

getFirstResult

public int getFirstResult()

setFirstResult

public Search setFirstResult(int firstResult)
Zero based index of first result record to return.

getPage

public int getPage()

setPage

public Search setPage(int page)
Zero based index of the page of records to return. The size of a page is determined by maxResults. If page is specified first result is ignored and the first result returned is calculated by page * maxResults.

getMaxResults

public int getMaxResults()

setMaxResults

public Search setMaxResults(int maxResults)
The maximum number of records to return. Also used as page size when calculating the first record to return based on page.

calcFirstResult

public int calcFirstResult()
Returns:
Zero based index of the first record to return. Calculation is based on page * maxResults or firstResult if page is not specified.

clearPaging

public void clearPaging()

copy

public Search copy()
Create a copy of this search. All collections are copied into new collections, but them items in those collections are not duplicated; they still point to the same objects.
